question_sentence: Texts sent to former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows during the Jan. 6 riots were made public. What did Donald Trump Jr. text him?
choices: “It has gone too far and gotten out of hand.”

question_sentence: Warriors star Stephen Curry set a new all-time record for made 3-pointers in the NBA. Whose record did he break?
Girl Named Tom made history on “The Voice” by becoming:
choices: The first group to win the competition
The first winner coached by Kelly Clarkson
The first winner to perform only song covers
The first winner from the United States

question_sentence: Congress passed a crucial defense bill this week. How much funding would it provide to defense programs?
The Arctic Siberia reached its hottest temperature on record. How warm did it get?
Travis Hunter, the No. 1 high school football recruit, flipped his commitment to which HBCU program this week?
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe made history this week by becoming the first spacecraft to:
choices: Traverse the moon in its entirety
Reach the outer atmosphere of Mars
Return to the moon after coming back to Earth

question_sentence: Beloved author, professor and feminist bell hooks has died. What is her birthname?
Which retail chain announced raising its minimum full-time hourly wage to $18.50 starting in 2022?
This image from Tuesday was taken in:
How much longer could the pandemic last in the UK, according to England’s chief medical officer?
evidence: ‘Each six months will be better than the last six months’, Professor Chris Whitty told the Commons Health and Social Care Committee this week, but he said it would be another year and a half before a wide range of vaccines covered all

question_sentence: Liberal Democrat candidate Helen Morgan has become North Shropshire’s new MP after she claimed victory in the by-election by how many votes?
evidence: Formerly an ultra-safe Conservative seat, this is the first time in almost 200 years the constituency has voted in a non-Conservative candidate

question_sentence: Residents at a care home in Oxfordshire got a bit of early Christmas cheer when two members of which animal species stopped by for a surprise visit?
evidence: Humboldt penguins Charlie and Pringle popped in to see pensioners at Spencer Court at the request of the care home team, as a form of therapy for residents. The winged duo’s visit was part of a programme of animal enrichment led by Heythrop

question_sentence: Who was crowned 2021 Formula 1 world champion this week?
evidence: The Red Bull driver became Formula 1's 34th world champion

question_sentence: How many of Boris Johnson’s Conservative MPs rebelled against the government in a vote seeking to introduce domestic Covid passports?
evidence: It was the biggest parliamentary rebellion yet against the prime minister, who won the vote with the help of Labour support.

question_sentence: Students walked out on which well-known journalist and polemicist after they made an unannounced speech at a Durham University event?
evidence: Liddle was invited to speak at a dinner at Durham University’s South College by the principal Tim Luckhurst, who castigated the students as ‘pathetic’ as they left.

question_sentence: Scientists have discovered that which New Zealand marine predator feeds on sharks?
evidence: The discovery makes New Zealand leopard seals part of a tiny club of marine predators that do so. The study found shark remains in the waste of leopard seals, and visible signs of struggle with sharks on seals’ bodies, indicating the marine

question_sentence: Who was crowned 2021’s person of the year by Time magazine?
evidence: The magazine described its choice as a ‘clown, genius, edgelord, visionary, industrialist and showman’, listing his achievements in space travel, alternative energy and electric cars

question_sentence: According to new modelling, what is the best-case number of further Covid-19 related deaths the UK could see by next April if no further restrictions are implemented?
evidence: The worst-case scenario, according to modelling research by the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM), could mean a further 82,000 deaths - more than half as many as the total 147,000 recorded in the UK so far.

question_sentence: Which country has become the first in Europe to legalise the growing and possession of cannabis for personal use?
evidence: Under the new laws, anyone aged 18 or over will be allowed to possess up to seven grams of the drug without risk of prosecution. Growing up to four cannabis plants at home, and storing up to 50g of the dried product, will also be permitted

question_sentence: Which state, led by Governor Andy Beshear, is dealing with the aftermath of a series of tornados that killed dozens and caused widespread destruction?
evidence: Several states were affected by the historic and deadly tornadoes that tore through the central and southern US, but Kentucky in particular has seen some of the worst damage.

question_sentence: Who was named Time magazine’s Person of the Year?
evidence: Elon Musk; billionaire, Tesla leader and space exploration proponent, was named Time magazine’s Person of the Year.

question_sentence: California Gov. Gavin Newsom says he is looking to draft a law similar to the Texas abortion bill, which would empower citizens to seek legal action against distributors of what kind of product?
evidence: The California bill would allow private citizens to seek injunctive relief “against anyone who manufactures, distributes, or sells an assault weapon or ghost gun kit or parts in the State of California.”

question_sentence: Which electric car company won the MotorTrend 2022 Truck of the Year Award?
evidence: The award was given to Rivian for its R1T pickup truck, making it the first truck not manufactured by one of Detroit’s ‘Big Three’ automakers to win the award since 2008.

question_sentence: Which university reported a campus-wide outbreak of Covid-19 that it says is made up of a “very high percentage” of Omicron variant cases?
evidence: Cornell University reported the outbreak and has moved to full remote learning, including the facilitation of final semester exams online for its more than 25,000 students.

question_sentence: Which country will become the first in the European Union to legalize cannabis for recreational use?
evidence: Malta is the first in the European Union to legalize recreational cannabis use in a limited capacity for adults 18 and over.

question_sentence: Which NFL team has fired head coach Urban Meyer after less than one season on the job?
evidence: Urban Meyer was removed as head coach of the Jacksonville Jaguars, a decision that team owner Shad Khan said was difficult to do but “imperative for everyone.”

question_sentence: Which island destination, which usually attracts millions of tourists a year, welcomed only 45 international visitors in 2021?
evidence: Bali received only 45 international visitors in 2021 due to strict coronavirus restrictions.

question_sentence: Microsoft said that international hackers are working to exploit a critical flaw in a widely-used software known as “Log4j.” What does the software in question do?
evidence: The Java-based Log4j software is used by organizations around the world to log information in their applications. The vulnerability could affect hundreds of millions of devices around the globe.

question_sentence: A digital art NFT recently commanded attention when it was accidentally sold for $2,844 — nearly $280,000 under its estimated value. What does NFT stand for?
evidence: NFT stands for “non-fungible token,” and is a type of tradeable, digital art linked to cryptocurrency and blockchain technology.
